DOC.brief_summary: RATIONALE : Bone marrow peripheral stem cell transplantation may able replace immune cell destroy chemotherapy radiation therapy use kill tumor cell . PURPOSE : Phase I trial study effectiveness bone marrow peripheral stem cell transplantation treat patient hematologic cancer .
DOC.brief_title: Bone Marrow Peripheral Stem Cell Transplantation Treating Patients With Hematologic Cancer
DOC.detailed_description: OBJECTIVES : - Determine toxicity unmanipulated bone marrow augment CD34+ enrich peripheral blood stem cell patient hematologic malignancy undergo allogeneic transplantation . - Evaluate treatment regimen term kinetics hematopoietic engraftment , infection , severity graft-vs-host disease , relapse rate , cost effectiveness patient population . OUTLINE : Patients undergo allogeneic transplantation comprise unmanipulated bone marrow filgrastim ( G-CSF ) -mobilized , CD34+ enrich peripheral blood stem cell day 0 . Patients receive graft-vs-host disease prophylaxis comprise cyclosporine IV 24 hour day -1 methylprednisolone IV oral prednisone daily day 7-65 . Patients also receive G-CSF subcutaneously daily blood count recover . Patients follow weekly 3 month , 6 month 1 year , annually 5 year . PROJECTED ACCRUAL : A total 30-60 patient accrue study .
DOC.criteria: DISEASE CHARACTERISTICS : Diagnosed hematologic malignancy eligible active allogeneic bone marrow transplantation protocol leukemia , lymphoma , myeloma , aplastic anemia treatment protocols HLAidentical one antigenmismatched related donor PATIENT CHARACTERISTICS : Age : 10 65 Performance status : Not specify Life expectancy : Not specify Hematopoietic : Not specify Hepatic : Not specify Renal : Not specify Other : No known sensitivity E. coli derivative PRIOR CONCURRENT THERAPY : See Disease Characteristics
